text.tspan: (it may be useful to explain how findings will be
presented, e.g. explaining custom graphs that you
may have designed to show things efficiently.)
* This part might not be necessary or might only be added if you completed the project only to find that it didn't work but want to set an 'exit condition' to say it is good enough for the
time and cost limitation - this is still generally an acceptable practice and examiners are aware of the limitations (but obviously speak to your adviser as to whether this is something
you want to have). Another point for this is that, usually for a PhD, that one plans around multiple iterations and each iteration may have a short report on what was achieved prior to
starting the next iteration. The final iteration may be having satisfied all the needs or having satisfied enough of them to end the project.
(methodology explains what is needed to say
constitute a partial solution that would still
explain experiments to do and implication of
(this may be the biggest part. Writeup may have a
chapter that flows from these plans.)
